column4: what is package name that take care of mounting/unmounting .iso images ?
mount -o loop?
i installed minimal ubuntu and it seems i dont have mount package, i tried with afuse and autofs i think but both not working
whoa. no mount?
yes, no mount
do you have a network connection?  can you just lookup what package provides mount?
on synaptic it drops all but "mount"
fdsss , i instaled autofs and afuse, but seems they not what is needed
according to dpkg -S (thanks jatt), the "mount" package provides mount
apt-get install mount?
does "mount" package exist ?
it says i have it already
cd / ; find | grep mount | grep bin
maybe it's just not in your path?
/bin/mount ; /bin/umount
then you have mount
try /bin/mount -o loop /bla/foo.so /mnt/mountpoint
yes it seems so, but is not working with nautilus
ah.  dunno.  i've never used nautilus
i was running fvwm2 and then blackbox for years :P  i just decided to install ubuntu the other day
:D
